extendedInfo.description: The Jardogs FollowMyHealthâ¢ Universal Health Record mobile companion app provides users with access to your medical records and health information wherever you go!Enjoy the convenience of securely accessing your medical records and health information while away from your computer via your Android phone or tablet, including fax and email capability. If you currently use an online health record or patient portal powered by Jardogs to connect with your hospital, doctorâs office or healthcare facility on your computer, this app extends that accessibility to your mobile devices! Use your same login to access your Universal Health Record account with your mobile device and take control of your health and wellness with features such as: - Fax or email your medical records - Request prescription refills - View and request appointments - Communicate with your healthcare providers - Get address and navigation assistance to doctorsâ offices - Access vaccination, allergy and treatment records - See lab results - Manage your familyâs records via healthcare proxy IDs - Note: Current enrollment in a healthcare organization-sponsored online health record or patient portal powered by Jardogs is required.

reviews.title: Great idea, problems make it worthless :/
reviews.comment: Same problem as everyone else. I tried downloading and using this on my samsung galaxy and logging in on facebook and google. I was able to log in to both but the program would not recognize the login and said the program needed an update, that is not available becuase I just downloaded the program.
reviews.author: Bekah C

reviews.title: Issues still not fixed
reviews.comment: Samsung Note 2.. App says it uses credentials from other apps then doesn\'t recognize it. Are you sure you can safeguard my health info??
reviews.author: Kathy Freundt

reviews.title: Glad I\'m healthy
reviews.comment: A new way for the medical profession to drive my blood pressure to the moon. It is the most frustrating app I\'ve Ever not used. Oh! I think its caused me to have heart imputation.
reviews.author: Charles Gray

reviews.title: Cannot get signed in
reviews.comment: Will not sign my live or fb in on my Samsung note. Live comes up as a blank screen & fb just keeps running trying to get info, but never does.
reviews.author: Tammy Wheeler

reviews.title: UGH
reviews.comment: Can\'t sign in, tells me it needs a desk top to work. So why is there an app??? Perhaps the kinks should be worked out before releasing for users to download!!
reviews.author: Marcia Luarca

reviews.title: Logging in
reviews.comment: I log into my gmail account everyday. This app states my password is wrong. Uninstalling....
reviews.author: Ericka Trusty

reviews.title: PROBLEMS!
reviews.comment: I\'ve logged on over the last several days and sent emails to my dr and none of them are showing up. They just disappeared!!!
reviews.author: sarah loveless

reviews.title: very disappointed
reviews.comment: As with the others, I cannot get this to download to my Samsung Galaxy either.  It is very frustrating!  Makes me very disappointed!
reviews.author: Karen Murphy

reviews.title: Needs Work, but Great Potential
reviews.comment: If your medical provider uses the FollowMyHealth system, then this app will allow you unprecedented access to your personal medical history. That is, if it actually worked.  Initial download often crashes the app. So far, I can use the in app messaging, the providers list, and the appointment calendar. The health tracker and the medications modules crash the app when they attempt to download info.  I hope this is fixed soon.
reviews.author: Nathan Weber

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work
reviews.comment: Downloaded, signed in (another thing I\'m not happy about) and it says I don\'t have the latest version. Uninstalled.
reviews.author: Dawn Thomas

reviews.comment: It will not let me view my medical records. The most important part of the app. Besides the appt calender
reviews.author: Bridget Willis

reviews.title: Next generation health empowerment!
reviews.comment: Great APP with instant access.  Know your health, know your results, be in charge of you!  We need to keep innovations like this coming.  Wish xray results could be seen.
reviews.author: Lisa Scholz

reviews.title: Needs Major Fixes
reviews.comment: After signing in, it won\'t \"accept\". Waste of time!
reviews.author: Whitney Davis

reviews.title: Poorly implemented
reviews.comment: App doesn\'t even uses the android native account manager and instead prompts me to enter my Google account password via a web page. This is inherently fishing/insecure and as a developer that\'s a sign of a poor insecure design. Uninstalled.
reviews.author: Ralf Ralfoide

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work from cellphone.
reviews.comment: It works great from a PC though. I wish they\'d fix the mobile app. and I\'d give it a higher score.
reviews.author: Cherry Goode

reviews.title: Can\'t send emails to your doctor from app!
reviews.comment: New\342\230\205Noticed this app doesn\'t send msgs to my doctor through the app. It shows sent via app but never shows anything sent via PC. Pls. Fix. Took 1 star. Annoying. Can\'t communicate effectivel. Also fix scheduling appts.... the doctor\'s office has No clue when I mk an Appt through this app. I need to see folders too. Clicking on folders bring error msg. The screen goes black then force closes. These are main things needed for Effective communication. Pls fix.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works Great, Helpful Features
reviews.comment: No glitches or force close, works smoothly. The features I use most are to easily pull up a list of health conditions, a list of vital history and vaccines with dates, and the list of scheduled appointments, especially past appointments with dates & times. Keeps me well informed and on top of on my info. I only wish I could sort vitals by dates so I can see Weight, Temperature, Blood Pressure, etc all together per visit rather than have to scroll down to the next list to view the other vitals pertaining to the same visit.  (HTC EVO 4G LTE)
reviews.author: Angelina Madrid

reviews.title: Not as useful as it could be..
reviews.comment: So, the great reason to use a federated login system like Google is .. well, so you can use a federated login system.  The fact that the app doesn\'t plug in to Android\'s authentication API means that every time you want to use the app you have to log in through a clunky web-based UI.  Hint to the developers: Android has a reasonably secure API designed for dealing with federated login schemes.  It even works with Facebook\'s authentication provider on Android.  You should use it.
reviews.author: Archturiat Baumann

reviews.title: Works fine on Asus TF700
reviews.comment: You must have an account on FMH through your health care provider in order for this app to work.
reviews.author: Derek Rowell
